content.question:
A study will be conducted to investigate whether there is a difference in mean tail lengths between two populations of snow leopards. Random samples of leopards will be selected from both populations, and the mean sample tail length will be calculated for each sample.
Which of the following is the appropriate test for the study?

choices.label: A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population means
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population proportions
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a population proportion
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a sample mean
A one-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a population mean

content.answer: A two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population means

topic.text: 7.8: Setting Up a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
